Trans-pacific travel is the key to Hawaiʻi’s health. Now is the time to work together to ensure that our residents & local businesses can safely reopen. We need to take personal responsibility. Wash your hands. Wear your mask. Avoid large gatherings. Stay home if you feel sick.
A multi-layers health screening process is set in place to protect our health and safety - temperature checks and mandatory Travel and Health form to be filled out. #HawaiiCovid19
Pretesting for transpacific travel: those who have a valid negative #COVID19 test prior to arriving will NOT be subject to the 14-day quarantine. #HawaiiCovid19

We're well-prepared to handle this level of new cases. We have good capacity for testing, contact tracing & care w/in our hospitals & healthcare facilities. The rise in cases is a clear sign that our contact tracing & testing programs are working.

Hawai‘i’s re-opening strategy for businesses and operations is informed by the @WHO,  the @CDCgov, and Johns Hopkins Public Health Principles for a Phased Reopening, based on Contact Intensity & Number of Contacts.

It is important to act with care by maintaining physical distancing and safe practices throughout the re-opening, to protect the health and safety of the people of Hawai‘i. I am committed to making decisions based on data, science, and best practices.

The state will start to gradually re-open medium-risk businesses & operations beginning in June. The re-opening of high-risk businesses and operations will eventually follow, as long as Hawai‘i’s disease activity continues to remain manageable.

In addition, I unveiled the re-opening and recovery plan for the State of Hawai‘i -- a strategy that conveys the coordinated, statewide approach to jumpstarting the economy and recovery from the #COVID19 crisis.

The form also includes information on the mandatory requirements for the 14-day quarantine along with penalties.

All visitors and residents arriving through Hawaiʻi’s airports will be required to complete a Hawaiʻi Department of Agriculture form that will be distributed onboard their flight. They will retain the form when disembarking the aircraft.

It's critical we further mitigate the spread of the virus by both residents & visitors who are coming from out-of-state. This plan was developed in collaboration with our county mayors & Hawaiʻi’s business, community & visitor industry leaders.

The mandate -- the first such action in the nation -- applies to all arrivals at state airports from the continental U.S. and international destinations and extends to other private and commercial aircrafts.

I want to thank the Board, DOE, parents, students and the community for their understanding as we work though this difficult time. We will get through this crisis if we continue to work together as a community.

I encourage parents to check the DOE site for details on the meals programs. The situation is constantly changing, & they will be adjusting its plans to meet the changing conditions & address issues, such as opportunities for distance learning, special needs students & graduation

As decisions for extension & closures are being announced, I’m pleased that the DOE has a plan in place to continue providing meals to our students, especially to those who need it most. The comprehensive plan will help communities from Kaʻū to Kapaʻa.
Educating Hawaiʻi’s students remain our top priority. And we know that in addition to providing a positive learning environment, schools also provide a safe place for our keiki.

I commend and fully support the Hawaiʻi Department of Education (DOE) for furthering the state’s efforts to implement social distancing. These are challenging decisions being made every day across the state but are essential to help mitigate the spread of COVID-19.
This is a community effort. Each of us has a part to play. And I know that the best way to get through this crisis is by working together for the sake of our entire state. #coronavirus

The community needs to anticipate that more stringent measures may need to be introduced but we want to ensure everyone that any direction or mandates made will be based on facts and what’s best for our communities.
These are difficult times which require difficult decisions. We know these actions are extreme, but we know they will help #flattenthecurve and lay the groundwork for a quicker recovery.
They have my full support and commitment to continue to work cooperatively as we move forward in our efforts to fight COVID-19.

The mayors understand the unique needs of their communities &are putting in place restrictions and guidance that best meet those needs. Their efforts align with CDC guidelines and the direction provided by the State Department of Health & the Hawaiʻi Emergency Management Agency.

I want to thank mayors Caldwell, Kawakami, Kim & Victorino for their swift actions in implementing the directives. These are hard decisions. We all understand the dire nature of the challenges facing our state due to the #COVID19 pandemic and are moving together in our response

It's essential that our gov't operations & services cont., & we must keep all of our employees & community safe & healthy. These are difficult times, but Hawai’i has a history of coming together when faced w/ challenges. I’m confident that together we will rise to the task.

These are unprecedented times. The actions we’re announcing may seem extreme to some, & we know that they will have negative effects on our economy. But we are confident that taking aggressive actions now will allow us to have a quicker recovery when this crisis is over. #COVID19

•The @DLNR is closing parks, offices with in-person access & large.
•All events at the State Capitol, State Art Museum, &tours at Washington Place suspended.
•The @DCCA suspended all combat sports.
• Cancelled events at Aloha Stadium & Hawaiʻi Convention Center for 30 days.

•I've banned all non-essential travel for state workers
•Temporarily closing State Libraries to public access to evaluate & adjust operations. There will be no fees for late returns and the Library online resources will still be available.

For the next 15 days, I have directed the depts to have all non-essential staff stay home. Essential workers will continue to report to work. All employees will continue to be paid and will still be eligible for sick leave, vacation and other benefits:

oEnsuring employees have benefits, even if employees are not at work
oHalting eviction for non-payment of rent.
oHalting foreclosures
oWorking w/ public & private utility to avoid shut-off of service to critical utilities - electric, gas, water, internet, landline telephone &📱

•The Office of Consumer Protection is working w/ its Landlord-Tenant Center, & effective already are emergency provisions applicable to tenants
•The following are being discussed w/ our community’s business partners & non-profit organizations to maintain stability for families:

•For both the utilities and essential services, government resources and support can be deployed as necessary.
•The one-week waiting period for unemployment insurance benefits is waived for those unemployed because of COVID-19.

•Infrastructure/services that'll cont. operations➡️utilities, fuel producers, shipping facilities & industry, financial institutions, financial services, telecommunications, wholesaler/distributors, grocery stores, pharmacies, gas stations & other industry vital to our community

#COVID19: The following steps have been taken:

At the start of a new decade, we have it within our power to change the lives of our working families & change the trajectory of Hawaiʻi’s future. That is the underlying belief of this bold joint package. We have much on our plate. Let’s get to work. #SustainableHawaii #SOTS2020

Stewardship of the ʻāina has always been a central part of public policy in Hawaiʻi but for those under 21, it's more about your future. I challenge you to follow @GretaThunberg who believes we all have a part to play in preventing climate change. #SOTS2020 #SustainableHawaii

Sustainability has been an integral part of our efforts. To sustain our economy, lifestyle & natural environment we’ve developed clean energy sources & will meet our 2020 energy goal of attaining 30 percent of our energy needs from renewable sources. #SOTS2020 #SustainableHawaii

The rise of technology changes the face of everything in society; it has been a game changer for agriculture in Hawaiʻi. It has enabled farmers to produce higher yields in the field and more precise targeting strategies in the marketplace. #SOTS2020 #SustainableHawaii

We propose to invest $200M for roads and infrastructure to stimulate interest in the @UHWestOahu housing development plans. We are also proposing to provide $75M for affordable housing on the Neighbor Islands. #SOTS2020 #SustainableHawaii

In Hawaiʻi, the biggest expense for working families by far is housing. Our joint package proposes to build 17,000 affordable homes over the next decade on state-owned land in partnership with private developers. #SOTS2020 #SustainableHawaii

We want every three and four-year-old in Hawaiʻi to have the opportunity to attend childcare or preschool, and we want to make an aggressive start now. The proposed bill will expand affordable childcare for our working families. #SOTS2020 #SustainableHawaii

We agreed to put more money into pockets of working people. A modest increase phased over time, combined with targeted tax relief, could result in an annual cash benefit of $4,400 to each worker. #SOTS2020 #SustainableHawaii

The @hihousedems and @hawaiisenate leadership, community leaders and my administration challenged each other to reduce the cost of living for our working families. We committed to a package of bills and will usher them through the legislative process. #SOTS2020 #SustainableHawaii
